oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Sgt. Thomas Jefferson Warr, CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Thomas Jefferson Warr was born in Hardin County, Tenn., on August 26, 1839. He enlisted in the Confederate Army and was serving in Phillips' Battery at the time of his capture in Macon, Tenn., on February 9, 1865. He was held in the custody of the Provost Marshal at Memphis, Tenn., until he was released on February 17 by Capt. Wilson, Asst. Provost Marshal. He died on January 18, 1917, in Whiteville, Tenn.
